description: {"blocks":[{"key":"2lsq1","text":"Immunoprecipitation is a procedure by which proteins or peptides that react specifically with an antibody are removed from solution and examined for quantity or physical characteristics. Immunoprecipitation can also be used to “enrich” a protein population prior to Western Blotting. For example, one can perform immunoprecipitation with a pan-specific antibody against a protein of interest followed by Western blotting with a modification-specific antibody (such as a phospho-specific antibody or an acetylation-specific antibody).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text:
{"blocks":[{"key":"5tccn","text":"1X Cell Lysis Buffer: 
25mM Tris-HCl pH 7.5, 150mM NaCl, 0.1% Triton X-100, 2mM EDTA, 1µg/ml leupeptin, 1µg/ml aprotinin, 1mM Na3PO4,1mM PMSF, 5mM NaF, 3mM Na4P2O4","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":21,"style":"bold"},{"offset":128,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":131,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":158,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":160,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":162,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"druc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aqjvd","text":"5X SDS sample Buffer: 
312.5mM Tris-HCl (pH 6.8) 10% SDS (w/v), 250mM DTT, 50% Glycerol, 0.05% Bromophenol Blue (w/v). Use at 1X","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":21,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6hmoc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fe233","text":"10X SDS Running Buffer: 
Dissolve 144g of Glycine, 30g of Tris base and 10g SDS in 800ml of distilled H2O. Add distilled H2O to 1 liter. Use at 1X","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":23,"style":"bold"},{"offset":103,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":122,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"39qk8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"favs5","text":"Transfer Buffer: 
2.25g Tris base, 10.5g Glycine 1g SDS, 200ml Methanol. Add distilled water to 1.0L","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":16,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"t155","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"5isf9","text":"Tips:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":5,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"364ht","text":"1. The choice of lysis buffer depends on the location of the protein (membrane, cytosolic, nuclear).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5fn48","text":"2. Immunoprecipitates allowed to incubate overnight may have a higher background than ones processed for shorter periods of time due to time-dependent aggregation or denaturation of cellular proteins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1srrr","text":"3. Always use an isotype-matched irrelevant control antibody (monoclonal) or same-species serum from a non-immunized animal to remove non-specific antibody binding in cellular lysates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bof8t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"4efjq","text":"Collect cells and centrifuge at 1200 rpm for 5 minutes at 4\u00b0C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5o89a","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19435","duration":"300","label":"","guid":"29440A8E90694F669B7D19D67FA4DE70"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bg737","text":"Wash protein A, G, A\/G agarose beads with cell lysis buffer by pulsing in a microcentrifuge tube (two minutes at 5,000 rpm). Aspirate and discard supernatant. Wash the beads three times with cell lysis buffer.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":210,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"fce1h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cpdc9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"58626E20B7A611E8AEA39946BE74DC77","duration":120,"label":"","step_guid":"B4620A8897D84DACAEE9CB9EDCE353D9"}}],"guid":"B4620A8897D84DACAEE9CB9EDCE353D9","id":664290,"previous_id":null,"previous_guid":null,"section":"Preparation of antibody-protein G agarose beads"}
steps.section: Preparation of antibody-protein G agarose beads

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"c7h7a","text":"Adjust antibody concentration to 5-10\u00b5g\/ml in PBS and transfer 500\u00b5l of diluted antibody to 5-10\u00b5l of agarose beads for each sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"9B98263CBBDA41E2AC7E31224C775DC8","id":664293,"previous_id":664309,"previous_guid":"B4620A8897D84DACAEE9CB9EDCE353D9","section":"Preparation of antibody-protein G agarose beads"}
steps.section: Preparation of antibody-protein G agarose beads

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"9erdh","text":"Place the antibody-protein A, G, A\/G agarose mix on a shaker and rotate at 4\u00b0C for one hour.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"jgru","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19437","duration":"3600","label":"","guid":"945FA4D81D3C42EEB39D51DDB3E56ECE"}}],"guid":"5AC03D0D79A943669D172F8D2FD03466","id":664294,"previous_id":664293,"previous_guid":"9B98263CBBDA41E2AC7E31224C775DC8","section":"Preparation of antibody-protein G agarose beads"}
steps.section: Preparation of antibody-protein G agarose beads

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"a7bg5","text":"Spin down the protein A, G, A\/G beads for two minutes at 5,000 rpm and wash the antibody-beads three times with cell lysis buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"of6h","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19438","duration":"120","label":"","guid":"39572AE30AC84202AF257D6D0785048B"}}],"guid":"EBB1068A5A634126B9981C4ED9600CB4","id":664295,"previous_id":664294,"previous_guid":"5AC03D0D79A943669D172F8D2FD03466","section":"Preparation of antibody-protein G agarose beads"}
steps.section: Preparation of antibody-protein G agarose beads

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"eggc8","text":"Discard the supernatant and immediately add 800 \u00b5l of ice-cold lysis buffer to the cells and vortex, then incubate for 30 minutes on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ac55v","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19439","duration":"1800","label":"","guid":"619C5AE24A764A49A0A26A5FF082635D"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"434cq","text":"Freeze and thaw the samples with dry ice for two more cycles or sonicate for 15 seconds to ensure the full release of the proteins from the cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2klpj","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19440","duration":"15","label":"","guid":"A101BD03F99B475291336759799270DD"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"93j1d","text":"Spin lysates at 14,000 rpm in a pre-cooled centrifuge for 10 minutes and keep the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6370d","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19441","duration":"600","label":"","guid":"03EA9A9F9181448382B06EA6C53B7F8E"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"38n6q","text":"Adjust the protein concentration of the supernatant to 1-2 mg\/ml with lysis buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f93bj","text":"Mix 100-500\u00b5l of cell extract with antibody-protein A, G, A\/G agarose and rotate the samples at 4\u00b0C for about two hours.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cd0p4","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19442","duration":"7200","label":"","guid":"4FC77BF6246B47458C861597CCF8768D"}}],"guid":"B3040F23E6764194970F3CEF213DF4A0","id":664300,"previous_id":664299,"previous_guid":"C9E1CDDD06174A6DBF973EAD027AA017","section":"Immunoprecipitation"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"741gu","text":"Collect the agarose beads by pulsing in a microcentrifuge tube (two minutes at 5,000 rpm, 4\u00b0C). Aspirate and discard the supernatant. Wash the beads 3 times with ice-cold cell lysis buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ctvuf","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19443","duration":"120","label":"","guid":"481FE24A2748460BB399B0D6BD2F8F74"}}],"guid":"931D28E0989C49C0B1220DFE855609C3","id":664301,"previous_id":664300,"previous_guid":"B3040F23E6764194970F3CEF213DF4A0","section":"Immunoprecipitation"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1p03p","text":"After the final wash, remove the supernatant and add 20\u00b5l of 2X SDS sample buffer. Boil for 5 minutes at 95\u00b0C and spin down the beads at maximum speed in a microcentrifuge for 5 minutes at room temperature. Carefully pipette off the supernatant.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":246,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"7m5eq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"6991B110B7A611E8AEA39946BE74DC77","duration":300,"label":"","step_guid":"3DBE9787168940D2B0C6E13B6E79880E"}}],"guid":"3DBE9787168940D2B0C6E13B6E79880E","id":664304,"previous_id":664311,"previous_guid":"931D28E0989C49C0B1220DFE855609C3","section":"Immunoprecipitation"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2shfd","text":"Load 30\u00b5l of sample in each well of a 1.5mm thick gel. Run the gel according to manufacturer\u2019s recommendations and continue with immunoblotting using BioLegend\u2019s Western Blotting protocol (alternately, radiolabeled proteins prepared from target cells can be used to directly visualize the immunoprecipitated protein).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"1945919BA4D74902BAEACD5D3C175554","id":664305,"previous_id":664307,"previous_guid":"3DBE9787168940D2B0C6E13B6E79880E","section":"Immunoprecipitation"}
